addImageListener

void addImageListener(MicroscopeImageListener listener)
                      throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                             MeasurementRunningException
Adds a listener which is invoked if the camera of the microscope made a new picture.

Parameters:
listener - Listener which detects new pictures.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException
MeasurementRunningException

setExposure

void setExposure(double exposure)
                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                        MeasurementRunningException
Sets the exposure. If more than one camera is initialized, it sets the exposure of all cameras. Set to -1 if exposure should not be set.

Parameters:
exposure - The exposure.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException
MeasurementRunningException

getExposure

double getExposure()
                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Gets the exposure. If more than one camera is initialized, returns the exposure of the first camera.

Returns:
The exposure.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

setExposures

void setExposures(double[] exposures)
                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                         MeasurementRunningException,
                         java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Sets the exposures of the cameras. Should have the same size as cameras, otherwise an exception is thrown. Each element can be set to -1 to not set the exposure for the given camera.

Parameters:
exposures - The exposures.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException
MeasurementRunningException
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if number of elements in exposure array is unequal to the number of cameras.

getExposures

double[] getExposures()
                      throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Gets the exposures of the initialized cameras.

Returns:
The exposures.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

setCameras

void setCameras(java.lang.String[] cameras)
                throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                       MeasurementRunningException
Sets the cameras with which it should be imaged. If set to null, the default (currently initialized) camera is used. Each camera should only appear ones in the array. One element of the array can be NULL, such that the default camera is used.

Parameters:
cameras - Device names of the cameras
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException
MeasurementRunningException

getCameras

java.lang.String[] getCameras()
                              throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Gets the cameras.

Returns:
The cameras.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException
